title: Connexin26 hemichannels with a mutation that causes KID syndrome in humans lack sensitivity to CO<sub>2</sub>
abstract: Mutations in connexin26 (Cx26) underlie a range of serious human pathologies. Previously we have shown that Cx26 hemichannels are directly opened by CO<sub>2</sub> (<xref>Meigh et al., 2013</xref>). However the effects of human disease-causing mutations on the CO<sub>2</sub> sensitivity of Cx26 are entirely unknown. Here, we report the first connection between the CO<sub>2</sub> sensitivity of Cx26 and human pathology, by demonstrating that Cx26 hemichannels with the mutation A88V, linked to Keratitis-Ichthyosis-Deafness syndrome, are both CO<sub>2</sub> insensitive and associated with disordered breathing in humans.
